news_header: Fort Liberty military base is to be renamed back to Fort Bragg by Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth.
news_original_title: USA:n puolustusministeri palautti Fort Braggin sotilastukikohdan nimen entiselleen
news_text: In the United States, Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth has ordered the Fort Liberty military base to reinstate its name as Fort Bragg. The name was changed in 2023 to remove names associated with Southern leaders. Fort Bragg, located in North Carolina, is the largest military base in the U.S. with nearly 60,000 soldiers and was established in 1918, named after General Braxton Bragg.
